meanings.definition: Provide (someone) with a reason for doing something.
meanings.sent1: Encouraging words can motivates people to work harder.
meanings.sent2: A good teacher motivates students to learn by making the lessons interesting.
meanings.sent3: The promise of ice cream motivates the kids to finish their homework quickly.
meanings.sent4: The thought of success motivates him like a powerful engine driving him forward.
meanings.sent5: The image of achieving his dream motivates him every day to strive for excellence.

meanings.definition: Stimulate (someone's) interest in or enthusiasm for doing something.
meanings.sent1: A captivating story motivates readers to keep turning the pages.
meanings.sent2: The coach motivates the team by showing belief in their abilities.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party motivates the office staff to meet their targets.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery motivates her to go for a run every morning.
meanings.sent5: The sound of applause motivates the performer to give their best on stage.
